Starting Line: A large rose-tree stood near the entrance of the garden: the roses growing on it were white, but there were three gardeners at it, busily painting them red.
First came ten soldiers carrying clubs; these were all shaped like the three gardeners, oblong and flat, with their hands and feet at the corners.
“Idiot!” said the Queen, tossing her head impatiently;
“And who are _these?_” said the Queen, pointing to the three gardeners
“Are their heads off?” shouted the Queen.
“Come on, then!” roared the Queen, and Alice joined the procession,
“She boxed the Queen’s ears—” the Rabbit began.
“Get to your places!” shouted the Queen in a voice of thunder.
Alice began to feel very uneasy.
She was looking about for some way of escape.
I waited till the eyes appeared, and then nodded.
“How do you like the Queen?” said the Cat in a low voice.
Alice thought she might as well go back, and see how the game was going on,
By the time she had caught the flamingo and brought it back,
When she got back to the Cheshire Cat, she was surprised to find quite a large crowd collected round it:
The King’s argument was, that anything that had a head could be beheaded, and that you weren’t to talk nonsense.
Alice could think of nothing else to say but “It belongs to the Duchess: you’d better ask _her_ about it.”
And the executioner went off like an arrow.
